Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class OAuthContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.OAuthContext
  • @RequiresApi(23)
public final class OAuthContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class that implements the Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Grant and Authorization Code Grant as the calling client to an OAuth authorization server. The resource owner is suitable in cases where the resource owner has a trust relationship with the client. the authorization code grant flow is suitable when the authorization code has been generated using an alternate factor, such as a desktop browser.

    In contrast to the iOS version, there is no setter for the clientSecret. This can be passed via the parameters hash map in authorize(String, String, String, Map, boolean, IResultCallback) (with the key client_secret).

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    2.1.5

      • authorize

        public void authorize​(@NonNull
                      java.lang.String endpointUrl,
                      @NonNull
                      java.lang.String clientId,
                      @NonNull
                      java.lang.String username,
                      @NonNull
                      java.lang.String password,
                      @Nullable
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> parameters,
                      boolean ignoreSsl,
                      @NonNull
                      IResultCallback<OAuthToken> callback)
        Acquires a security token from the token endpoint using OAuth resource owner password grant type.
        Parameters:
        endpointUrl - the location to the OAuth endpoint.
        clientId - the unique identifier between the service and the app.
        username - the username.
        password - the password for username.
        parameters - additional parameters associated with the request.
        ignoreSsl - the flag indicates whether SSL checks should be weaken with the parameters set in NetworkHandler.setOnPremiseSslParameter(SSLContext, TrustManager, HostnameVerifier). If those haven't been customized and ignoreSsl == true, the default implementations, provided in NetworkHandler will be used.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a OAuthToken and VerifySdkException.

      • getScope

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String[] getScope()
        Returns the scopes to be authorized.

        For mobile multi-factor authentication (MMFA) registration using the ROPC flow, a scope must contain mmfaAuthn. For OpenID Connect registration using ROPC, a scope must contain oidc.

        Returns:
        the scopes to be authorized.

      • setScope

        public void setScope​(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String[] scope)
        Sets the scopes to be authorized.

        For mobile multi-factor authentication (MMFA) registration using the ROPC flow, a scope must contain mmfaAuthn. For OpenID Connect registration using ROPC, a scope must contain oidc.

        Parameters:
        scope - scopes to be authorized.
